title: Kill Caustic
lyrics:
Kill Caustic Lyrics[Verse 1]
So, I'm feeling much worse now
You're better, you're better
Your designer drug
Won't work, won't work for me
Connect to a three volt
I hope your battery dies
How could you run
On such, on such voltage?

[Pre-Chorus]
All the same, I remain
The one to blame
And I'm demonized, purified
Justified, as you let yourself show
[Chorus]
So now, you'll love these screams, what's left of me
(Don't speak)
Love these screams, like I do
(My name)

[Verse 2]
As the infinite stops cold
Just nine and the six are gone
Guess I was the one to
Ride that, ride that dirty ride
That is turning too fast now
I c-c-cannot, cannot hold on
But at this pace
Who would, who would want to?

[Pre-Chorus]
All the same, I remain
The one to blame
And I'm demonized, purified
Justified, as you let yourself show

[Chorus]
So now, you'll love these screams, what's left of me
(Don't speak)
Love these screams, like I do
(My name)
Don't ever speak my name
You might also like[Bridge]
Don't ever speak my name again, don't ever speak it
Don't ever speak my name again, don't speak, don't speak
Don't speak my...
Don't speak my name

[Chorus]
So now, you'll love these screams, what's left of me
(Don't speak)
Love these screams, like I do
(My name)1Embed
annotation:
[('So now, you’ll love these screams, what’s left of me', [['The person is mesmerized by the narrator’s pain and sorrow.']]), ('And I’m demonized, purified
 Justified, as you let yourself show', [['The narrator has been brainwashed many times and is used to it, just to make the person accept the narrator.']]), ('All the same, I remain
 The one to blame', [['The narrator is blamed for all the pain they’ve received, because the person is trying to prove that the narrator’s weak.']]), ('Don’t ever speak my name again, don’t ever speak it
 Don’t ever speak my name again, don’t speak, don’t speak
 Don’t speak my...
 Don’t speak my name', [['The narrator does not ever want to speak with the person again, after all the pain they’ve been through.']]), ('Connect to a three volt
 I hope your battery dies', [['This shows that even though the narrator might give the person another chance, the narrator hopes that the person hurts the narrator again, so they could prove that the person is actually more evil and insincere than they seem.']]), ('Your designer drug
 Won’t work, won’t work for me', [['The narrator shows that they won’t fall for the things that the person is trying to do to hurt the narrator, because the narrator is already used to the pain they’ve been given.']]), ('So, I’m feeling much worse now
 You’re better, you’re better', [['The narrator has been emotionally hurt by someone  and the person that hurt the narrator feels worthy because of the pain they’ve caused the narrator.']]), ('How could you run
 On such, on such voltage?', [['The person is asking how could this person live doing such terrible things or gain their hapinnes from the pain of others.']])]

title: Miss Murder
lyrics:
Miss Murder Lyrics[Chorus]
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Ho-oh-oh

[Verse 1]
With just a look, they shook, and heavens bowed before him
Simply a look can break your heart
The stars that pierce the sky, he left them all behind
We’re left to wonder why he left us all behind

[Chorus]
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Ho-oh-oh
[Verse 2]
Dreams of his crash won’t pass, oh, how they all adored him
Beauty will last when spiraled down
The stars that mystify, he left them all behind
And how his children cried, "He left us all behind!"

[Chorus]
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Ho-oh-oh...

[Bridge]
What's the hook, the twist within this verbose mystery?
I would gladly bet my life upon it
That the ghost you love, your ray of light will fizzle out
Without hope
We're the empty set just floating through empty skin
Ever searching for what we were promised
Reaching for that golden ring, we'd never let go
But who would ever let us put our filthy hands upon it?

[Chorus]
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Ho-oh-oh
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Oh-oh!You might also like25Embed
annotation:
[('[Bridge]', [['Davey Havok chips in on the vanities  of fame and the chase for “immortality.”



Trivia: Davey has condemned the vanities of fame before:

As waves of plastic fame go out of fashion
You’re going out, going out forever unknown']]), ('What’s the hook, the twist within this verbose mystery?
 I would gladly bet my life upon it
 That the ghost you love, your ray of light will fizzle out
 Without hope', [['Despite his hopes and vanities, Davey knows that The Celebrity’s “beauty” won’t last. The “immortality” he attained in suicide will eventually fade.

He addresses his legions of fans and tells them that the “ghost” they love will “fizzle out”; The Celebrity will eventually pass out of public memory.

My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings;
Look on my works, ye mighty, and despair!
Nothing beside remains. Round the decay
Of that colossal wreck, boundless and bare,
The lone and level sands stretch far away.']]), ('We’re the empty set just floating through empty skin
 Ever searching for what we were promised', [['In mathematics, an “empty set” refers to a set that contains no elements at all. (0, 0).

In this song, “we” refers to everyone: lost souls trapped in human bodies (“wrapped in skin”), trying to make sense of our place here;  including our celebrities.

It conveys a sense of nihilism: life is meaningless and humanity isn’t special in the universe. We’re the “empty set.” We contain nothing of value or significance. All of our efforts in chasing beauty, fame, and immortality are vain.

Even The Celebrity’s search for these things is meaningless.

Life’s but a walking shadow, a poor player
That struts and frets his hour upon the stage
And then is heard no more: it is a tale
Told by an idiot, full of sound and fury,
Signifying nothing.
-Shakespeare']]), ('Dreams of his crash won’t pass, oh, how they all adored him
 Beauty will last when spiraled down', [['The Celebrity’s suicide won’t be forgotten; dreams of his “crash” won’t pass from public memory.

His “beauty” will last because he killed himself. It spirals down because people looked up to him.

Alternately, it spirals down from heaven, or the “afterlife.”



These are just a few fallen idols who became legends after their death.']]), ('With just a look, they shook, and heavens bowed before him
 Simply a look can break your heart
 The stars that pierce the sky, he left them all behind
 We’re left to wonder why he left us all behind', [['The Celebrity is described in god-like terms. Even the heavens bowed before him. This is a sly comment on the nature of celebrity worship. We have a tendency to make our celebrities and rock icons deities; they take on myth-like proportions.

Our Celebrity left the world (“the stars”) and the adoring public (“his children”) behind when he killed himself.']]), ('Reaching for that golden ring, we’d never let go
 But who would ever let us put our filthy hands upon it?', [['The golden symbolizes beauty, fame, and the Eternal. As creatures bound by time, we’re unworthy of anything lasting or ‘permanent’.']]), ('Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
 Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life?', [['The Celebrity is haunted by the impermanence of beauty – possibly his fame, his youth, and/or his art.

He appeals to Miss Murder, a personification of death, because he believes killing himself must be the only way to make these things “stay.”





These are just a few fallen idols who became legends after their death.']])]

annotation: [('Gorgeous eyes shine suicide\n When will we be invisible?', [['This line, along with the previous “Listen as I break, break the fourth wall seal” I believe is Davey acknowledging the listener; the main audience of AFI’s “Decemberunderground” was punk and emo teens, who were often depressed and listened to music to escape the world and sometimes even their suicidal thoughts.']]), ('[Bridge]', [['The person is dialing 8 44 444 7777 444 777. If you look up the corresponding letters on a phone’s buttons, it spells “thisir”. This doesn’t make much sense, however, if we assume the person was about to press one last 7, being interrupted by the drum, it would spell “this is”, which is how the next line starts. Davey is well known for his hidden messages and riddles.']]), ('Listen as I break\n Break the four wall seal', [['The “fourth wall” is the imaginary wall between the fictional characters in a performance and the the audience, so named because theater sets often had three visible walls.']])]

annotation: [('One at a time, I’m lost in little deaths', [['“Little death” is a direct translation of the French “la petit mort”, a euphemism for an orgasm. Thus, Davey Havok is saying that he uses sex to help ignore the parts of his life that are painful or unfulfilling.']])]

annotation:
[('Put on your face and let’s pretend', [['Put on your make-up. It’s like wearing a mask, pretending to be someone you’re not.']]), ('Am I beautiful?
 Am I usable?', [['Sometimes we do things just to feel good, even if
for only a moment.
Sometimes we do things to fit in, to feel like we have purpose, even if for only a moment.']]), ('What a shame, such a sad disgrace
 Such a pretty face, but she’s not regretful', [['Although the found girl understands that what she has done to herself isn’t good and unsightly, she won’t change her actions; she’ll do it again.']]), ('Five A.M. on the bathroom floor, from the night before
 Do you find me dreadful?', [['The person was found on the floor after a night of partying. They were in the bathroom because they were feeling sick. “Do you find me dreadful?” is exactly as it says: the found person is asking if you dislike their actions; do you hate them for making such a mess of themselves.']])]

37mm Lyrics[Verse 1]

annotation:
[('Your sins into me', [['“Your sins into me” is also the main chorus line of AFI’s 2003 single “Silver and Cold”. Its reappearance here is likely an intentional callback, as both songs share a theme of taking on the pain and ‘sins’ of one’s lover – essentially hurting yourself to heal someone else.']]), ('Do you fall too? (every time that I)', [['Do you hurt when I hurt?']]), ('If you believe in me, how can I be dissolving?', [['He has the love and support of this person, but depression is still taking over. Believing in him isn’t enough.']]), ('Press me to your lips and I’ll suck the poison out
 Who will heal me, me?', [["Outdated first aid procedures for a venomous snakebite involved another person sucking the poison out of the wound. This is because at least some species' of snake have venom that is not dangerous if ingested, but fatal in the bloodstream. However, if one had any gastrointestinal bleeding, it would in theory be possible to die of sucking another person’s snakebite."]]), ('If you’d believe me, I’d tell you everything', [['In John 20:26-29, Jesus appears to a disciple who had previously disbelieved in his resurrection and allows him to feel the wounds in his hand and side from the Crucifixion. He then says, “Thomas, because you have seen Me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”

The image of feeling wounds in another’s hands plus this comment about believing suggests that the speaker believes this person really should believe in them without having to be told.']]), ('Just give me your hands and I’ll let you feel the wounds
 They put in me', [['In John, Chapter 20, Jesus appears to the disciples after his resurrection and shows them “his hands and his side,” presumably showing them his wounds from the Crucifixion. One disciple refuses to believe,

Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side

The speaker of this song is comparing himself to Jesus, suffering on behalf of others and inviting another to see how he has suffered.']])]

annotation:
[('Just ask them if the sky will
 Open and save us from the truth
 They say that they’d leave today
 Just without, without you', [['These lines are a stab at various religions and religious cults, many of which promise that the day of reckoning will come and only those who follow the group’s beliefs will be taken to Heaven/nirvana/etc. while the rest of the world is left to burn.']]), ('Why live for pain in the name
 The name of, name of love?', [['This line seems to be a stab at asceticism and martyrdom – religious practices generally revere people who devoted themselves wholly to their faith at the expense of their own safety and comfort. Here, Davey Havok is asking the rhetorical question: “if your religion is all about love and goodness, like you say it is, why does it require so much suffering of its adherents?”.']]), ('Don’t tell them you can walk on water
 Or they may drink your blood', [['In Christian theology, Jesus Christ is said to have walked on water and people who participate in holy communion are though to be drinking the (literal or symbolic, depending on sect) Blood of Christ.']]), ('How is it divine
 When it’s flawed design?', [['In debates over the existence of god, religious people often argue that the world is too perfect to have existed without some sort of intelligent design. Non-religious people are generally quick to point out that it is a “flawed design”, due to naturally-occurring problems such as disease and natural disasters.']])]

annotation:
[('[Chorus]
 Let’s love, like 17
 I’m in love with poisoning
 Only bring your pretty, frightful gifts to me
 Let’s love and kill like 17 now', [['Davey doesn’t like to give away the meanings behind his songs, fearing it will take away from what people have interpreted it to be, but I speculate that it’s about being 17 years old, wanting to live out your last few days as a reckless teenager.  At 17, you aren’t quite a child, but you aren’t an adult either.

“Let’s love, like 17,”
This line could mean wanting to be reckless with love, the way 17-year-olds are.

“I’m in love with poisoning.”
Teenagers are poisoning, or tricking people so that they can get their way.

“Only bring your pretty, frightful gifts to me,”
Teenagers want what they want, they are willing to be destructive as well.  Some examples are alcohol and smoking.  They are glamourized (pretty) but frightening at the same time.

“Let’s love, and kill like 17 now.”
This line ties the first three together.  Let’s love like 17– recklessly and by ‘poisoning’ others, and kill like 17, with ‘pretty, frightful gifts’.']]), ('Would you allow our play
 To leave no bone unbroken?', [['He’s asking if you would play a game and not let anything get in the way or lost along the way . He’s asking  more so stating that there comes risk  along with the “play” .']]), ('[Verse 1]
 If you had a day
 Would you give me a moment?', [['He wants to know if he could have a little place in the life of the one he loves.']])]

And I fear the future's here
It's 1985 (and it feels like, feels like survival)
It's 1985 (and it feels like, feels like survival)
Can you read my mind?You might also likeEmbed

title: Anxious
lyrics:
Anxious Lyrics[Verse 1]
Tear into silence, my ears begin to ring
Begin to ring in the new sound anxiously
Oh, I am anxious and aching, breathing the burning air
Caring for something that is not there

[Verse 2]
Knowing what's fated, begin my fatal flight
Flying obscenely into the light
But the light will evade me to bring down punishment
Punishing soundly it lets me live
[Chorus]
Swing the serenade (I heard it swing)
Swing love down and find the saddest song
I heard you swing the promises (You'll watch me swing now)
Swing love now and choke what we've become

[Verse 3]
Black without blindness, my eyes begin to sting
As my lips part to poison, sweet poisoning
Oh god, I feel like I'm dying, I've found death finally
And it feels like heaven, I'll never reach

[Chorus]
Swing the serenade (I heard it swing)
Swing love down and find the saddest song
I heard you swing the promises (You'll watch me swing now)
Swing love now and choke what we've become

[Bridge]
Swinging now, will you watch me?
Swinging now, will you watch me?
Turn it down, drown it slowly
Is it off? I'm still listening
Swinging now, will you watch me?
Swinging now, will you watch me?
Turn it down, drown it slowly
Is it off? I'm still listening
You might also like[Chorus]
Swing the serenade (I heard it swing)
Swing love down and find the saddest song
I heard you swing the promises (You'll watch me swing now)
Swing love now and choke what we've become

(I'll bite your lips though I know better than this)
(This is a death I can't resist)Embed
annotation: [('(I’ll bite your lips though I know better than this)\n (This is a death I can’t resist)', [['“I’ll bite your lips though I know better than this” calls to mind some fairly direct sexual imagery, so the “death” he refers to in the last line likely refers to a “little death” – translated to French, la petit mort, a slang term for orgasm.']])]

title: The Face Beneath The Waves
lyrics:
The Face Beneath the Waves Lyrics[Verse 1]
Someone said they saw me fall apart
Part of me collected and destroyed
Tell me what it's like to hold a heart
When it shatters
Someone said that they ran into her
Asked if there was any word of me
And she swore that everything we were
Never mattered

[Pre-Chorus]
(There is a face beneath the waves)
[Chorus 1]
I will return again
I will return to you
I will return again
I am part of you
I am

[Verse 2]
Are you somewhere listening to me?
Have these whispers finally found the cracks?
White walls won't forever keep these screams
They will shatter
Secretly you know that I'm still here
While you're being held you're so alone
For you killed the only one who cared
Let it shatter

[Pre-Chorus]
(There is a voice within these walls)

[Chorus 1]
I will return again
I will return to you
I will return again
I am part of you
I am
You might also like[Bridge]
What do you do when my soul invites you?
Oh, you'll see me again
You know this will never end
What do you do when your heart reminds you?
Oh, you'll put me to death
But I will return again

[Chorus 2]
I will return again
I will return to you
I will return again
I am part of you
I will be with you again
With you again
I will be with you again
I will be with you
I will be with you again
With you again
I will be
I am part of you
I amEmbed
annotation: [('I will be with you again', [['This evokes New Years Day by U2. “I will be with you again.” Only in this case it’s haunting and terrifying instead of redeeming and positive.']])]

title: Miss Murder
lyrics:
Miss Murder Lyrics[Chorus]
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Ho-oh-oh

[Verse 1]
With just a look, they shook, and heavens bowed before him
Simply a look can break your heart
The stars that pierce the sky, he left them all behind
We’re left to wonder why he left us all behind

[Chorus]
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Ho-oh-oh
[Verse 2]
Dreams of his crash won’t pass, oh, how they all adored him
Beauty will last when spiraled down
The stars that mystify, he left them all behind
And how his children cried, "He left us all behind!"

[Chorus]
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Ho-oh-oh...

[Bridge]
What's the hook, the twist within this verbose mystery?
I would gladly bet my life upon it
That the ghost you love, your ray of light will fizzle out
Without hope
We're the empty set just floating through empty skin
Ever searching for what we were promised
Reaching for that golden ring, we'd never let go
But who would ever let us put our filthy hands upon it?

[Chorus]
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Ho-oh-oh
Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life? Oh-oh!You might also like25Embed
annotation:
[('[Bridge]', [['Davey Havok chips in on the vanities  of fame and the chase for “immortality.”



Trivia: Davey has condemned the vanities of fame before:

As waves of plastic fame go out of fashion
You’re going out, going out forever unknown']]), ('What’s the hook, the twist within this verbose mystery?
 I would gladly bet my life upon it
 That the ghost you love, your ray of light will fizzle out
 Without hope', [['Despite his hopes and vanities, Davey knows that The Celebrity’s “beauty” won’t last. The “immortality” he attained in suicide will eventually fade.

He addresses his legions of fans and tells them that the “ghost” they love will “fizzle out”; The Celebrity will eventually pass out of public memory.

My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings;
Look on my works, ye mighty, and despair!
Nothing beside remains. Round the decay
Of that colossal wreck, boundless and bare,
The lone and level sands stretch far away.']]), ('We’re the empty set just floating through empty skin
 Ever searching for what we were promised', [['In mathematics, an “empty set” refers to a set that contains no elements at all. (0, 0).

In this song, “we” refers to everyone: lost souls trapped in human bodies (“wrapped in skin”), trying to make sense of our place here;  including our celebrities.

It conveys a sense of nihilism: life is meaningless and humanity isn’t special in the universe. We’re the “empty set.” We contain nothing of value or significance. All of our efforts in chasing beauty, fame, and immortality are vain.

Even The Celebrity’s search for these things is meaningless.

Life’s but a walking shadow, a poor player
That struts and frets his hour upon the stage
And then is heard no more: it is a tale
Told by an idiot, full of sound and fury,
Signifying nothing.
-Shakespeare']]), ('Dreams of his crash won’t pass, oh, how they all adored him
 Beauty will last when spiraled down', [['The Celebrity’s suicide won’t be forgotten; dreams of his “crash” won’t pass from public memory.

His “beauty” will last because he killed himself. It spirals down because people looked up to him.

Alternately, it spirals down from heaven, or the “afterlife.”



These are just a few fallen idols who became legends after their death.']]), ('With just a look, they shook, and heavens bowed before him
 Simply a look can break your heart
 The stars that pierce the sky, he left them all behind
 We’re left to wonder why he left us all behind', [['The Celebrity is described in god-like terms. Even the heavens bowed before him. This is a sly comment on the nature of celebrity worship. We have a tendency to make our celebrities and rock icons deities; they take on myth-like proportions.

Our Celebrity left the world (“the stars”) and the adoring public (“his children”) behind when he killed himself.']]), ('Reaching for that golden ring, we’d never let go
 But who would ever let us put our filthy hands upon it?', [['The golden symbolizes beauty, fame, and the Eternal. As creatures bound by time, we’re unworthy of anything lasting or ‘permanent’.']]), ('Hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I, hey (Hey!) Miss Murder, can I
 Make (Hey!) beauty stay if I take my life?', [['The Celebrity is haunted by the impermanence of beauty – possibly his fame, his youth, and/or his art.

He appeals to Miss Murder, a personification of death, because he believes killing himself must be the only way to make these things “stay.”





These are just a few fallen idols who became legends after their death.']])]

title: Don't Cha' Think
lyrics:
Don’t Cha’ Think LyricsDon Parks, Daryl Simmons and Kayo
I'm having fun, but all that I've done
It hasn't always been right
They say I misuse, that I break the rules
But that won't get me uptight
Now they're telling me, what I could
Never be
Always tryin' to bring me down
But I'm so strong, I'll prove them wrong
No matter what they say, I'm telling you
Right now
Don't you think it bothers me **
If you think It bothers me
It will never bother me. Oh No!

Oh...oh...oh repeat 3x
No

I've been around. Been up and down
This roller coaster of life

annotation:
[('I’ll give you my heart, my soul, my time, my love is a fountain
 I will be your earth, ooh, and all that you need for
 And even more
 ’Cause girl I love you more than words can show
 My love is pure
 I, I’d walk a thousand miles, sail a thousand seas
 Nothin’ will discourage me
 And I pray that you will be always there for me
 Forevermore', [['The second verse is explaining through metaphors that “he” will do anything to please his woman, which includes going above and beyond to provide for her. He also is implying that he will make sure she has the right foundation for a happy home. With the line “And I pray that you’ll be always there for me” is saying all he asks for in return is her unconditional love and support.']]), ('I’ll give you the sun, the rain, the moon, the stars and the mountains

 Forevermore', [['The first verse is explaining through metaphors that “he” will do anything to please his woman, which includes going above and beyond to provide for her. He also is implying that he will make sure she has the right foundation for a happy home. With the line “And I pray that you’ll be always there for me” is saying all he asks for in return is her unconditional love and support.']])]

lyrics:

Unit 1

I said a psy-cho-logy a ly a ly I said a psy psy-cho-logy

Cuz we're gunna start from unit one

Wilhelm Wundt made the first laboratory

James wondered how our minds help us survive

Watson, Skinner, Rayner, muthafrickin behaviorism
Humanistic and neuroscience, too

Or to the things your eyes have seen?

Biological, social, psychodynamic
Behavioral, cognitive, chillin in a hammock

Making more dirty bills than the Catholic church

Nicholas Cages is my favorites actor
Clinical, and psychiatry
I guess I’m done with this unit, let’s study psychology

Hindsight bias? What’s that?
I was always right, that is a fact
Might not believe you’re overconfident muthafricka…
But it’s like that
Let me tell you my theory, my hypothesis
Critical thinking is where the knowledge is
Ya making an experiment? It needs some op defs
If I can’t replicate it then you can hold ya breath
Now let’s talk about the research sensation
Case study, survey, naturalistic observation
Random samples let you generalize to a population
Without an experiment, make a correlation
Coefficient. Make a scatterplot
Make no illusory stuff or you’re distraught

Alright let’s go and discuss experiments…

Randomly assign those mothas to the groups

Or you may might get results that are weird-ah

Is simultaneously physical, invisible, biological

Neurons are the smallest guys of the bunch
Sensory neurons let you taste your lunch and
Motor neurons make you move your arms
Interneurons call the shots, man such a charm
Each one of these guys has three little bites:
The axon, cell body, and the dendrite
Now if they go too slow don’t get scared and leave
You can just speed it up with some myelin sheath

This may be a lot to remember all at once
But now we’re going on the beat tryna make you jump

Action potential is a little tiny charge
That sends some messages down, yeah they try to barge
When a neuron fires, those guys go down
And I swear they’re even faster than the speed of sound
Now there’s two types of signals to remember here:
Excitatory, inhibitory, but you have no fear cuz
If you pass the threshold with these
More neurons’ gonna fire just like a breeze!
Synapses, gaps where you gotta pass
Better hope your neurotransmitters shake their ass
Cause they carry the signals in this tiny gap
Only a matter of time before reuptake takes them back
There’s tons of neat types of these skeevy guys
My favorite are endorphins they give you such a high
If you want to mimic them get agonists
But otherwise block them with antagonists

(Voice) DJ turn it up! We’re absolutely jamming in here!

Did somebody say nervous? Like my favorite system-uh?
CNS is main but the PNS peripheral

And autonomic gets some crazy stuff in your glands

Now this sub-unit’s almost over, that’s right we’re almost done

Of genius. Frontal, parietal, lobes
This video’s winning 8 Golden Globes
Temporal, occipital lobes

I’m athletic, I use my motor cortex
And association areas for the rest
I like my Wernicke’s and Broca’s areas

annotation:
[('I’ll give you my heart, my soul, my time, my love is a fountain
 I will be your earth, ooh, and all that you need for
 And even more
 ’Cause girl I love you more than words can show
 My love is pure
 I, I’d walk a thousand miles, sail a thousand seas
 Nothin’ will discourage me
 And I pray that you will be always there for me
 Forevermore', [['The second verse is explaining through metaphors that “he” will do anything to please his woman, which includes going above and beyond to provide for her. He also is implying that he will make sure she has the right foundation for a happy home. With the line “And I pray that you’ll be always there for me” is saying all he asks for in return is her unconditional love and support.']]), ('I’ll give you the sun, the rain, the moon, the stars and the mountains
 I’ll give you the world, and all that you wish for
 And even more
 Girl, I’ll love you more than you could know
 And that’s for sure
 I’d climb the highest hill, cross the widest sea
 Nothin’ could discourage me
 And I pray that you’ll be always there for me
 Forevermore', [['The first verse is explaining through metaphors that “he” will do anything to please his woman, which includes going above and beyond to provide for her. He also is implying that he will make sure she has the right foundation for a happy home. With the line “And I pray that you’ll be always there for me” is saying all he asks for in return is her unconditional love and support.']])]

Ladies and gentlemen, homosexuals, lesbians, and transvestites

By placing me in the projects, I'm still the American Dream

Jeopardized my life by living around thugs
But I'm still the American Dream
Kicked outta Palmdale High School
Because I was considered a distraction to the educational process
I've traveled through the complete metamorphosis of the justice system
And I'm still the American Dream
Entered Juvenile Hall as a tadpole;
Hopped outta prison as a bull frog
But I'm still the American Dream
The most rejected, disrespected
When I went for a job I was never selected
But I am still the American Dream
And right about now
I find it quite serendipitous to see that all of you some-timin'
Wishy-washy, two-faced, back-stabbin'
Coniving hypocrites have accumulated here in my midst to persecute my character
With such flagrant slanderousity
But I counter-attack by calling it constructive criticism
And all of your negativity has been recycled into motivation
And I am still the American Dream
Amazing Grace, how sweet the sound that saved a wretch like me
I once was lost, but now I'm found; was blind, but now I see
There's a lot of people out there who can identify with me
Young lady right here, you may be a single teenaged mother
But you are still the American Dream
The lady next to you, yes. Your breasts may not be as big as men think they should be
But you are still the American Dream
Young man, you may not be a baller, shot caller
With 20 inch blades on the impala, but you are still the American Dream
Young man right here, you may have spent all your money on a hood rat bitch
And didn't get no pussy last night, but you are still the American Dream
Yes sir, I am just like Ham. I'm for the black man
The mexican, and even poor white
All human beings that have no rights. So put down your past, pick up your future
Follow me as we journey through the Red Sea
Cause I have been to the mountain top
I've seen the Promised Land
Mine eyes have seen the glory of the Underground Category
My mind has been delivered
My spirit has been reinstated from the Corporate World's modern-day slavery
I've been emancipated. Free at last! Free at last! Fuck a drug test
I'm fittin' to roll some grass. Love, peace, and Afro grease, Fro-ever! Buccooocc!
A-E-I-O-U, and sometimes W. 'Cuz I'm high, cuz I'm high, cuz I'm highYou might also likeEmbed

title: Palmdale
lyrics:
Palmdale LyricsJust like bums, we used to stay in the slums of LA by the way
Gang-bangers killin' each other for rep, sellin' rock cocaine on my doorstep
Had a ball to bounce plus a bike to ride, but my mama never would let me play outside
But when I got enrolled in elementary school, started bangin' like a fuckin' fool
So cool, throwin' up gang signs to the gangster beat, shot an enemy from across the street
Mama came home, said she got a good job. Daddy did too. Now they don't squab
Financially, we improvin'. 2 months later, son, we movin'
No more duckin' from shotgun shells. Bought a two-story house in East Palmdale
(give it to me now.)

Palmdale, come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
(Check it out, check it out, check it out.)
No more rats and no more roaches, livin' next door to football coaches
Now I got a new place to sell me crack. Now I got little white kids to jack
I stopped wearin' blue, wasn't trippin' on red. Too busy squabbin' with the skinheads
Stupid questions, distract the class. Rubbin' little white girls on the ass
I didn't really care if I passed or failed, I knew I was headed for the NFL
Until the playoff game, shoulder got hurt. I thought about my future, layin' in the dirt
I can't jump, I can't flinch. Superstar player, ridin' the bench
Graduate from school? Don't make me laugh. I got an F+ in basic math
(give it to me now.)

Palmdale, (Hell, yeah.) come back to me
I gotta do one song for my neighborhood. Bucccoooc!
Palmdale, come back to me
(check it out.)

I knew I couldn't make it in the white man's world, so I bought me some khakis and a Geri curl
I knew I couldn't make it to the NFL, so I went to East Palmdale and started slingin' yayo
For sure! I was makin' crazy dough. Should've dropped outta school a long time ago
Bought a cell phone, like a nut. Now I deliver like Pizza Hut
I drunk whisky and Bacardi. I sold dope to anybody
Me and my homies sold dubs and dimes, took turns bustin' rhymes just to pass the time
A white man drove up to my spot. He said, Hey, homeboy, what you got?
I put a fat rock inside his hand. About 25 sheriffs jumped out the van
(Get down, punk.)

Palmdale, (Hell, yeah) come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
(check it out, check it out, check it out.)
You might also likeCan't get drunk. Can't get blunted. LA County, 95 hundred
Crips wanna take my All-stars. Bloods wanna eat my Snicker bars
Them peckerwoods don't want none, but the Mexican's straight own one
Them Ese's, catorces, treces always try to test me
So I jumped off the bed, cause I ain't no punk. Jammed his head up against the bunk
Socked that Cholo in his chin. Black mother-fuckers scared to jump in
Sheriff broke it up when we hit the floor. I kept talkin' shit cause I want some more
Back in town, we get along with the brown. Now I'm in jail, they tryin' to beat me down
Jail is hell, but I'll adapt. Won't hesitate to get in a scrap
Cause I'm down for mine, and that's for certain, sittin' in the hole with my knuckles hurtin'
(Palmdale)

Palmdale, (Hell, yeah.) come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
(check it out, homeboy.)

Now I got a fucked up life. Two bad kids and a naggin' wife
Dead end job at the airport. Check too short to pay the house note
Turn on the TV, then I see different homeboys that went to school with me
Playin' in the NFL. We used to kick back in East Palmdale
Rodney Williams. Lorenz Tate. Zeno plays for Colorado State
I wish my homeboys much success, but at the same time, I still get depressed
Walkin' through the wind with a cup full of gin thinkin' 'bout things that could've, would've, should've been
I wipe my tears, sip my beers, wish good luck to my peers
(Palmdale.)
Palmdale, come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
Cause that's where my heartache began, heartache began

Palmdale, come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
Cause that's where my heartache began, heartache began

Palmdale, come back to me
(Hey, all the homeboys on the football team, where y'all at?)
Palmdale, come back to me
(Hey, wherever you at in the world, I don't care if you in Japan, Africa
Hey, you know how we used to do it, man. Hey, hey, hey.)
Yo, let me get a Palm (Palm!)
Yo, let me get a Dale (Dale!)
Yo, what do we sell? (YELL!)
Yo, where we fittin' to go? (We fittin' to go back to jail!)
[X4]

Dale. Palmdale. (Hey, everybody just clap your hands.)
Dale. Palmdale. (C'mon, c'mon, c'mon. Buci-buci-bucccoooc!)
Dale. Palmdale
Dale. (Where them Falcons at?) Palmdale. (It ain't over 'til the fat man sings.)
Dale. (Little Rock can't get none. What, what?) Palmdale
Dale. Palmdale
[Fade out.]5Embed
annotation:
[('Now I got a new place to sell me crack. Now I got little white kids to jack', [['Afroman can now sell crack in a white neighborhood. He says he can “jack” white kids which could be a double meaning, jack means rob so he could straight up rob them or he could rob them by selling the crack or drugs in general for a much higher price']]), ('Financially, we improvin’. 2 months later, son, we movin’', [['They are financially improving and after two months, his parents said they are moving to a better place']]), ('But when I got enrolled in elementary school, started bangin’ like a fuckin’ fool', [['Afroman is saying that when he got into elementary he started gangbanging, or doing things like robbing, selling drugs, and other things. He is basically saying he started the “gang life” from a young age']]), ('Can’t get blunted.', [['Blunted - The feeling that follows smoking a blunt. It usually makes one feel tired, weak, out of energy…']]), ('(Little Rock can’t get none. What, what?)', [['It’s common for people from the Antelope Valley to make fun of neighboring cities. In this case it’s nearby Littlerock located south east of Palmdale.']]), ('Palmdale, (Hell, yeah.) come back to me', [['Palmdale was the first community within the Antelope Valley to incorporate as a city on August 24, 1962; and the 32nd most populous city in California and ranks 158th nationally. The 2010 United States Census reported that Palmdale had a population of 152,750. The population density was 1,438.1 people per square mile (555.3/km2).



The racial makeup of Palmdale was 74,901 (49.0%) White (24.5% Non-Hispanic White), 22,677 (14.8%) African American, 1,316 (0.9%) Native American, 6,548 (4.3%) Asian (2.2% Filipino, 0.4% Indian, 0.4% Korean, 0.3% Chinese, 0.3% Vietnamese, 0.2% Japanese), 335 (0.2%) Pacific Islander, 38,773 (25.4%) from other races, and 8,200 (5.4%) from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino were 83,097 persons (54.4%). 38.1% of Palmdale is Mexican, 6.2% Salvadoran, 2.4% Guatemalan, 0.7% Puerto Rican, 0.5% Cuban, 0.4% Honduran, 0.4% Nicaraguan, 0.4% Peruvian, 0.3% Ecuadorian, 0.3% Colombian, and 0.2% Argentinean.']]), ('Mama came home, said she got a good job. Daddy did too. Now they don’t squab', [['Mum and dad got a decent job, making enough wage to move to a white flight neighborhood. Now that they are making enough money, his parents aren’t as stressed they used to be because of the lack of money to get the bills paid, they don’t argue and yell anymore.']]), ('Graduate from school? Don’t make me laugh. I got an F+ in basic math', [['Notice the plus sign. He excelled in failing at the subject, the only skill he does possess when it comes to school work. Quite common with athletes in our brilliant education system.

CNN analysis: Some college athletes play like adults, read like 5th-graders.']]), ('No more duckin’ from shotgun shells.', [['Drive by shootings are quite common in dangerous neighborhoods. In fact, California has been deemed the top state for these kind of violent acts.

One of the most disturbing realizations in that report is that 50% of all drive-by shootings from July 2006 through December occurred in California

Afroman must have become an expert at dodging them bullets, but he does not have to worry about that anymore!']]), ('I didn’t really care if I passed or failed, I knew I was headed for the NFL', [['A growing problem in the U.S, tackled by new education policies where a student must pass all his classes and maintain a certain GPA in order to participate in after school sport activities; a policy that might become mandatory for any school activities.']])]

title: Palmdale
lyrics:
Palmdale LyricsJust like bums, we used to stay in the slums of LA by the way
Gang-bangers killin' each other for rep, sellin' rock cocaine on my doorstep
Had a ball to bounce plus a bike to ride, but my mama never would let me play outside
But when I got enrolled in elementary school, started bangin' like a fuckin' fool
So cool, throwin' up gang signs to the gangster beat, shot an enemy from across the street
Mama came home, said she got a good job. Daddy did too. Now they don't squab
Financially, we improvin'. 2 months later, son, we movin'
No more duckin' from shotgun shells. Bought a two-story house in East Palmdale
(give it to me now.)

Palmdale, come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
(Check it out, check it out, check it out.)
No more rats and no more roaches, livin' next door to football coaches
Now I got a new place to sell me crack. Now I got little white kids to jack
I stopped wearin' blue, wasn't trippin' on red. Too busy squabbin' with the skinheads
Stupid questions, distract the class. Rubbin' little white girls on the ass
I didn't really care if I passed or failed, I knew I was headed for the NFL
Until the playoff game, shoulder got hurt. I thought about my future, layin' in the dirt
I can't jump, I can't flinch. Superstar player, ridin' the bench
Graduate from school? Don't make me laugh. I got an F+ in basic math
(give it to me now.)

Palmdale, (Hell, yeah.) come back to me
I gotta do one song for my neighborhood. Bucccoooc!
Palmdale, come back to me
(check it out.)

I knew I couldn't make it in the white man's world, so I bought me some khakis and a Geri curl
I knew I couldn't make it to the NFL, so I went to East Palmdale and started slingin' yayo
For sure! I was makin' crazy dough. Should've dropped outta school a long time ago
Bought a cell phone, like a nut. Now I deliver like Pizza Hut
I drunk whisky and Bacardi. I sold dope to anybody
Me and my homies sold dubs and dimes, took turns bustin' rhymes just to pass the time
A white man drove up to my spot. He said, Hey, homeboy, what you got?
I put a fat rock inside his hand. About 25 sheriffs jumped out the van
(Get down, punk.)

Palmdale, (Hell, yeah) come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
(check it out, check it out, check it out.)
You might also likeCan't get drunk. Can't get blunted. LA County, 95 hundred
Crips wanna take my All-stars. Bloods wanna eat my Snicker bars
Them peckerwoods don't want none, but the Mexican's straight own one
Them Ese's, catorces, treces always try to test me
So I jumped off the bed, cause I ain't no punk. Jammed his head up against the bunk
Socked that Cholo in his chin. Black mother-fuckers scared to jump in
Sheriff broke it up when we hit the floor. I kept talkin' shit cause I want some more
Back in town, we get along with the brown. Now I'm in jail, they tryin' to beat me down
Jail is hell, but I'll adapt. Won't hesitate to get in a scrap
Cause I'm down for mine, and that's for certain, sittin' in the hole with my knuckles hurtin'
(Palmdale)

Palmdale, (Hell, yeah.) come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
(check it out, homeboy.)

Now I got a fucked up life. Two bad kids and a naggin' wife
Dead end job at the airport. Check too short to pay the house note
Turn on the TV, then I see different homeboys that went to school with me
Playin' in the NFL. We used to kick back in East Palmdale
Rodney Williams. Lorenz Tate. Zeno plays for Colorado State
I wish my homeboys much success, but at the same time, I still get depressed
Walkin' through the wind with a cup full of gin thinkin' 'bout things that could've, would've, should've been
I wipe my tears, sip my beers, wish good luck to my peers
(Palmdale.)
Palmdale, come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
Cause that's where my heartache began, heartache began

Palmdale, come back to me
I need you and I love you, baby
Palmdale, come back to me
Cause that's where my heartache began, heartache began

Palmdale, come back to me
(Hey, all the homeboys on the football team, where y'all at?)
Palmdale, come back to me
(Hey, wherever you at in the world, I don't care if you in Japan, Africa
Hey, you know how we used to do it, man. Hey, hey, hey.)
Yo, let me get a Palm (Palm!)
Yo, let me get a Dale (Dale!)
Yo, what do we sell? (YELL!)
Yo, where we fittin' to go? (We fittin' to go back to jail!)
[X4]

Dale. Palmdale. (Hey, everybody just clap your hands.)
Dale. Palmdale. (C'mon, c'mon, c'mon. Buci-buci-bucccoooc!)
Dale. Palmdale
Dale. (Where them Falcons at?) Palmdale. (It ain't over 'til the fat man sings.)
Dale. (Little Rock can't get none. What, what?) Palmdale
Dale. Palmdale
[Fade out.]5Embed
annotation:
[('Now I got a new place to sell me crack. Now I got little white kids to jack', [['Afroman can now sell crack in a white neighborhood. He says he can “jack” white kids which could be a double meaning, jack means rob so he could straight up rob them or he could rob them by selling the crack or drugs in general for a much higher price']]), ('Financially, we improvin’. 2 months later, son, we movin’', [['They are financially improving and after two months, his parents said they are moving to a better place']]), ('But when I got enrolled in elementary school, started bangin’ like a fuckin’ fool', [['Afroman is saying that when he got into elementary he started gangbanging, or doing things like robbing, selling drugs, and other things. He is basically saying he started the “gang life” from a young age']]), ('Can’t get blunted.', [['Blunted - The feeling that follows smoking a blunt. It usually makes one feel tired, weak, out of energy…']]), ('(Little Rock can’t get none. What, what?)', [['It’s common for people from the Antelope Valley to make fun of neighboring cities. In this case it’s nearby Littlerock located south east of Palmdale.']]), ('Palmdale, (Hell, yeah.) come back to me', [['Palmdale was the first community within the Antelope Valley to incorporate as a city on August 24, 1962; and the 32nd most populous city in California and ranks 158th nationally. The 2010 United States Census reported that Palmdale had a population of 152,750. The population density was 1,438.1 people per square mile (555.3/km2).



The racial makeup of Palmdale was 74,901 (49.0%) White (24.5% Non-Hispanic White), 22,677 (14.8%) African American, 1,316 (0.9%) Native American, 6,548 (4.3%) Asian (2.2% Filipino, 0.4% Indian, 0.4% Korean, 0.3% Chinese, 0.3% Vietnamese, 0.2% Japanese), 335 (0.2%) Pacific Islander, 38,773 (25.4%) from other races, and 8,200 (5.4%) from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino were 83,097 persons (54.4%). 38.1% of Palmdale is Mexican, 6.2% Salvadoran, 2.4% Guatemalan, 0.7% Puerto Rican, 0.5% Cuban, 0.4% Honduran, 0.4% Nicaraguan, 0.4% Peruvian, 0.3% Ecuadorian, 0.3% Colombian, and 0.2% Argentinean.']]), ('Mama came home, said she got a good job. Daddy did too. Now they don’t squab', [['Mum and dad got a decent job, making enough wage to move to a white flight neighborhood. Now that they are making enough money, his parents aren’t as stressed they used to be because of the lack of money to get the bills paid, they don’t argue and yell anymore.']]), ('Graduate from school? Don’t make me laugh. I got an F+ in basic math', [['Notice the plus sign. He excelled in failing at the subject, the only skill he does possess when it comes to school work. Quite common with athletes in our brilliant education system.

CNN analysis: Some college athletes play like adults, read like 5th-graders.']]), ('No more duckin’ from shotgun shells.', [['Drive by shootings are quite common in dangerous neighborhoods. In fact, California has been deemed the top state for these kind of violent acts.

One of the most disturbing realizations in that report is that 50% of all drive-by shootings from July 2006 through December occurred in California

Afroman must have become an expert at dodging them bullets, but he does not have to worry about that anymore!']]), ('I didn’t really care if I passed or failed, I knew I was headed for the NFL', [['A growing problem in the U.S, tackled by new education policies where a student must pass all his classes and maintain a certain GPA in order to participate in after school sport activities; a policy that might become mandatory for any school activities.']])]

title: The American Dream
lyrics:
The American Dream LyricsYes! Yes! Thank you for inviting me here for my final speech
Ladies and gentlemen, homosexuals, lesbians, and transvestites
Allow me to introduce myself as the Hungry Hustler, Afroman
I am the American Dream. Even though the government tried to experiment with me

Surrounded by drugs

Kicked outta Palmdale High School
Because I was considered a distraction to the educational process
I've traveled through the complete metamorphosis of the justice system
And I'm still the American Dream
Entered Juvenile Hall as a tadpole;
Hopped outta prison as a bull frog
But I'm still the American Dream
The most rejected, disrespected
When I went for a job I was never selected
But I am still the American Dream
And right about now
I find it quite serendipitous to see that all of you some-timin'
Wishy-washy, two-faced, back-stabbin'
Coniving hypocrites have accumulated here in my midst to persecute my character
With such flagrant slanderousity
But I counter-attack by calling it constructive criticism
And all of your negativity has been recycled into motivation
And I am still the American Dream
Amazing Grace, how sweet the sound that saved a wretch like me
I once was lost, but now I'm found; was blind, but now I see
There's a lot of people out there who can identify with me
Young lady right here, you may be a single teenaged mother
But you are still the American Dream
The lady next to you, yes. Your breasts may not be as big as men think they should be
But you are still the American Dream
Young man, you may not be a baller, shot caller
With 20 inch blades on the impala, but you are still the American Dream
Young man right here, you may have spent all your money on a hood rat bitch
And didn't get no pussy last night, but you are still the American Dream
Yes sir, I am just like Ham. I'm for the black man
The mexican, and even poor white
All human beings that have no rights. So put down your past, pick up your future
Follow me as we journey through the Red Sea
Cause I have been to the mountain top
I've seen the Promised Land
Mine eyes have seen the glory of the Underground Category
My mind has been delivered
My spirit has been reinstated from the Corporate World's modern-day slavery
I've been emancipated. Free at last! Free at last! Fuck a drug test
I'm fittin' to roll some grass. Love, peace, and Afro grease, Fro-ever! Buccooocc!

annotation:
[('Blazin blunts in a beat-up taurus', [['“Blazing” is another way to say smoking—usually said with a certain vigor to it—as if to suggest the smokers of the blunt are getting especially high.

“Beat up Taurus” refers to the car made by Ford. The Taurus was a sedan made from 1985-2019, and the earlier models are generally associated with being cheap, disposable, beater cars. It’s possible Afroman was trying to draw an allusion between the lower socio-economic status of those smoking the blunt to the cheaper cost of the car.

In other words, they were smoking one of these



Inside one of these']])]

annotation:
[('Nineteen ninety-two Fleetwood Grove', [['This is a popularly mis-printed lyric.  The correct line is “nineteen-ninety-Fleetwood Brougham,”, not “grove.”

“Brougham” is a top-of-the-line model of the Cadillac Fleetwood.']]), ('Cluck heads walking up and down the block', [['“Cluckheads” is another name for Crack-Heads.  Also a term used to denote someone who exchanges oral sex for cash.

Interstingly, the following line “ba-kaa!” could have any meaning from a simple expletive, to an outright insult directed at their meaningless actions.']]), ('But the ghetto is inside me
 Ghetto memories', [['Although Afroman is out the ghetto, memories of his time in the hood is still in his head.']]), ('Daytons', [['Daytons are these kind of rims:']]), ('Spotlight po-po gets searched once more', [['Afroman gets caught by the cops. Po-po being a term for cops.']]), ('Colt 45 got your boy on buzz', [['Buzz, a term used when someone is a little drunk.']]), ('Getting faded', [['Getting high. (Either off weed and/or beer, you decide)
http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=get%20faded']]), ('[Afroman singing]', [['Afroman has a surprisingly good singing voice in which he portrays getting fucked up with drugs and alcohol while living in the ghetto']]), ('Hookers on the corner trying to make a sale', [['People need to make money somehow, and as females, they would probably get robbed trying to sell drugs.']]), ('I’ proud of the ghetto, proud to survive the ghetto
 You know, stay alive in the ghetto
 Drink Colt 45 in the ghetto
 Struggle and strive to get out the ghetto
 I’ out the ghetto', [['Although the statistics of African American’s who die before the age of 25 is unknown, 1 in 4 African Americans will go to jail in their lifetime based on statistics from the U.S. Department of Justice. Afroman is proud to be one of the few to survive/not be in jail.
http://bjsdata.ojp.usdoj.gov/content/pub/pdf/Llgsfp.pdf']])]
