lyrics:
Susan Lyrics[Verse 1]
Oh Susan, you were clued-in
You knew just how this thing would go
A prognosis that was hopeless
From the very first domino
I guess I see it all in hindsight
I tried to keep perspective despite
The flash of the fuse, the smell of cordite

[Chorus]
Now I'm in that place again
And I know he can't come in to get me
And someday he will live to regret me
Susan, I can see it now
[Verse 2]
Oh Suzie, they get to me
They can really be wearying
So he threw me rope and buoy
Let me use his decoder ring
There must have been some kind of parade
We kissed for a while to see how it played
And pulled the pin on another grenade

[Chorus]
But I'm in that place again
And I know he can't come in to get me
And someday he will live to regret me
Suzy, I can see it now

[Verse 3]
Oh Susan, the hope of fusion
Is that the halo will reappear
It may be pure illusion
But it's beautiful while it's here
I had some trouble with the goodbye
I checked my roman candle supply
And watched the vapor-trail in the sky

[Chorus]
But I'm in that place again
And I know he can't come in to get me
And someday he will live to regret me
Susan I can see it now
Susan I can see it now
Susan I can... see... it... nowYou might also likeEmbed

annotation:
[('I’ve got some cookies from our junk food run
 And here’s a couple beers so
 Let’s go create some fun', [['If you had to pick the most common criticism about Aimee Mann’s songwriting, it would be that she relies too often on mid-tempo songs about depressingly damaged characters.

The fun-sounding opening lines in this piece – matched with an upbeat tempo and bouncy melody – seem to be an ironic nod to that criticism.  The happy melody continues, but the fun-time lyrics are soon revealed to be a feint.']])]

title: It Takes All Kinds
lyrics:
It Takes All Kinds Lyrics[Verse 1]
As we were speaking of the devil
You walked right in
Wearing hubris like a medal
You revel in
But it's me at whom you'll level
Your javelin

Throwing your weight around the sun
Happier now that you've become
What you hated
[Verse 2]

Had half a chance
I was just one in a million
Of also-rans
Who was sure to be your victim
Of circumstance

Selling the soul you swore upon
Spreading the word that you've become
What you hated

[Bridge]
And if I don't understand...
Well, I guess it takes all kinds

I would like to keep this vision
Of you intact
When we'd hang around and listen
To Bacharach

And it loved you back
You might also like[Chorus]
Once you were just our dear friend Ron
Now you look out for number one
Who would've guessed that you'd become
What you hated

[Outro]
And I guess it takes all kindsEmbed

Like radium
Like Peter Pan

'Cept the freaks

annotation:
[('The long farewell
 Of the hunger strike', [['‘The long farewell’ may relate to a failed hunger strike, an allusion to a previous relationship, that dragged out and withered away. There could have been a lack of affection within this relationship, a ‘hunger strike’']]), ('’Cause I can tell
 You know what it’s like', [['Like Mann, this person is a “freak who suspects they could never love anyone,” and she notices this.']]), ('If you could save me
 From the ranks of the freaks
 Who suspect they could never love anyone', [['“Saving” in this sense is relieving the fear that Mann will never find love. If the character ​can save her, they will rescue her from the others who aren’t sure that they can love.']]), ('But can you save me?
 Come on and save me', [['Although the person she is singing about looks like a perfect fit, Mann is unsure of whether or not they are capable of saving her.']]), ('From the ranks of the freaks
 Who suspect they could never love anyone
 ’Cept the freaks
 Who suspect they could never love anyone
 But the freaks
 Who suspect they could never love anyone
 
 C’mon and save me
 Why don’t you save me?
 If you could save me
 From the ranks of the freaks
 Who suspect they could never love anyone
 
 Except the freaks
 Who suspect they could never love anyone
 Except the freaks who could never love anyone', [['Note the switch.  Earlier, the freaks couldn’t love anyone, full stop.  Now the freaks can love other freaks.  This can create a self-fulfilling prophecy: if you think of yourself as a freak, then whomever you fall in love with must be a freak, too, or else how could they possibly love a freak like you?']]), ('You look like a perfect fit
 For a girl in need of a tourniquet', [['A tourniquet is a method of tying off a body part (usually a limb) to stop the patient from bleeding to death.  It’s an extremely crude measure, though, and can lead to amputation or permanent damage, so it should only be used in the most desperate situations.']])]
